duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead a large group or the overall group in Clinical Data Management (CDM).
Hire, develop, and retain diverse top talent. Set clear and elevating goals for the team and individual direct reports.
Drive the ongoing development and refinement of CDM strategies, processes, standards, practices, efficiencies, and capabilities.
Identify and oversee continuous process improvement, including the development and updating of CDM SOPs, standards, systems, practices, policies, procedures, and other tools.
Oversee timely review of study protocols and assistance to site coordinators, investigators, and field clinical staff in collecting data to meet protocol requirements.
Ensure project deliverables and timelines for clinical data acquisition, quality checking, and reporting are consistently met.
Lead CDM support on regulatory submissions, regulatory/compliance audits and inspections, and other relevant regulatory inquiries.
Own and manage budget and resource plans for a large portion of or the overall CDM organization. Adhere to regulatory requirements of study conduct and industry standards of Good Clinical Practice.

education_certification.credential: MA/MS/PhD in life sciences or related discipline with 14+ years OR BA/BS in life sciences or related discipline with 16+ years of relevant CDM or other data analytics/data management experience.
